DataElement.preferredName: New Lesion Identification Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Response Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text code to represent disease response in a new lesion, using iRECIST response criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: New Lesion Identification Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized._A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Concepts.definition: The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Property.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support Immunotherapy Response Protocol

ValueDomain.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: User curated long name to support DCI, Modified RANO, ghd, 04.24.18

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

Concepts.definition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/22/18 tmt Transferred from DCI to NCI Standards context as part of RECIST FG content.  Changes should not be made to this VD without coordinating with DCI/Duke (Michael D. Leonard, Annie Tsui, Michael Goodin).Curated to support Immunotherapy Response Protocol

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Immunotherapy Response Protocol
